thread.title: North Dakota's Hrynkiw shuts out Vermont 2-0
thread.title_full: North Dakota's Hrynkiw shuts out Vermont 2-0

title: North Dakota's Hrynkiw shuts out Vermont 2-0
text:
Hrynkiw makes 27 saves for North Dakota in first shutout, 2-0 over Vermont THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   10:04   10:04   
Subjects: 
Vermont (336) 

BURLINGTON, Vermont â€” Career backup-turned-starting goalie Matt Hrynkiw made 27 saves in just his second start to lead North Dakota to a 2-0 win over Vermont Friday in men's college hockey. 
Hrynkiw, a junior who improved to 2-0 after replacing UND starter Cam Johnson in net, earned his first career shutout. He won his first start 5-2 over Bemidji State last weekend 
"I'm so proud of him," UND coach Brad Berry said. "Today in the morning skate he had a confidence. We want to see him keep that going. To get a shutout is a great accolade for him." 
Johnny Simonson's second-period goal was the only one Hrynkiw needed. Simonson jumped on a rebound and stuck it past Vermont goalie Mike Santaguida at 12:25 of the second period. 
Santaguida, who made 39 saves in all, had 33 in the first two periods to keep it a 1-0 game. 
"We brought up after the second period that there's a common theme going on with playing simple and scoring," Berry said. "You play simple you get a goal." 
North Dakota got an insurance goal on a power play early in the third period. Bryn Chyzyk took a feed from Nick Schmaltz and beat Santaguida at 5:25 of the third. 
Berry credited Schmaltz with making the play. "That's high end, that's elite," he said. "That's the puck poise and patience guys like that have." 
Unbeaten North Dakota (3-0-2) is ranked No. 1 in Berry's first season as head coach. It held onto the ranking after tying 4-4 with Bemidji State - Hrynkiw came on to start the third period of that game - then beating the Beavers 5-2. 
North Dakota outshot Vermont 41-27. 
The Catamounts (1-3-0) have lost three straight games. They haven't beat a No. 1-ranked team since downing Denver 6-4 on Oct. 10, 2009. 
Mario Puskarich's three-game scoring streak ended. 
The teams play the second game of the series Saturday.
